project.teaser: Air-to-ground communication technology is at the heart of the end-to-end air traffic management concept, which requires the global integration of current, future, and emerging communication networks. The present ATMACA (Air Traffic Management and Communication over ATN/IPS)...
project.objective: Air-to-ground communication technology is at the heart of the end-to-end air traffic management concept, which requires the global integration of current, future, and emerging communication networks. The present ATMACA (Air Traffic Management and Communication over ATN/IPS) project addresses an innovative solution enabling effective, seamless, interoperable air-to-ground datalink communication technologies and digital flight monitoring and management environment through aeronautical telecommunication (ATN) based on internet protocol suite (IPS) within all domains of flight. In this frame, ATMACA project aims at supporting “air-ground integration and autonomy” innovation flagship in the Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA) presenting the strategic roadmaps to achieve SESAR phase D “Digital European Sky” in European ATM Master Plan 2020 edition. ATMACA proposes a beyond the state-of-the-art IP-based datalink communication solution by introducing an application-layer mobility management for ATN and enabling commercial of-the-shelf equipment. It will also provide a next generation human machine interface (HMI) which will process higher quality data, enable interactions with the existing and future aeronautical applications and services, and meet the needs of end-users. ATMACA solution will be validated based on real-time simulations and real-time monitoring tests by considering relevant applicable SESAR key performance areas and indicators as well as industry standards. The consortium consists of a balanced mixed of universities and industrial partners (an air navigation service provider, an airline and a research and consultancy firm specialized in HMI design) to ensure the achievement of the project objectives. ATMACA project’s outcomes will deliver a robust and reliable communication and ATM solution serving as a baseline for the future ATN and next SESAR ATM solutions.
project.title: AIR TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT AND COMMUNICATION OVER ATN/IPS
project.keywords: Air traffic control, Aeronautical communication, IP networks, Data link technologies, Mobile IP

article.title: Innovative solutions for enhanced air traffic management

result.title: Review of Current and Future ATM Communication Networks
result.description: This report will present definition and development of current and future ATM communication framework.

result.title: HMI Requirements Report
result.description: It describes the HMI requirements and the research activities that lead to their definition.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan (CDEP)
result.description: It will describe Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan of the project activities, goals, result publication.

result.title: CPDLC Application Design Document
result.description: It encapsulates the essential components of the design of the CPDLC application, as well as all the information required for definition, interpretation and processing of CPDLC messages, the user guide required for its integrating and testing in WP 6.

result.title: Implementation of Website and Other Online Communication Activities
result.description: It will include websites, social media activity etc.

result.title: DLIC Application Design Document
result.description: It encapsulates the essential components of the design of the DLIC application, as well as all the information required for definition, interpretation, and processing of DLIC messages, and the user guide required for its integrating &testing in WP 6.

result.title: GRO Application Report
result.description: It will include benefits of the ATMACA concept on the Trajectory Prediction and Management.

result.title: Air Traffic Management and Communication over ATN/IPS for Future Datalink Communication

details.authors: Emre Aydoğan, Sergun Özmen, Fulya Aybek Cetek, Rosa María Arnaldo Valdés, Raquel Delgado-Aguilera Jurado, Angel Ernesto Carmona Fernández, Adrián Martínez Miralles, Tommaso Vendruscolo, Stefano Bonelli, Daniel Delahaye, Supatcha Chaimatanan, Feng Chen, Raouf Hamzaoui

result.title: Protocol Design Plan
result.description: It is a report that will describe the proposed communication protocol as designed.

result.title: Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: It describes the data management lifecycle for the data to be collected, processed and/or created by the project, defining the rules for maintaining data security.

category.title: aeronautical engineering

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
